body.p: When enough urine has been produced in the it leaves the through the ureters and urine is then transported to the.

response.name: ureters
response.feedback: Incorrect: Urine is produced in the nephrons, which are housed in each of the two kidneys. Once filtered, the blood exits through the renal vein and urine leaves each kidney through each ureter which is driven to the bladder. Through circular contraction urine is moved from the kidneys through the ureters, and into the bladder.

response.name: nephrons
response.feedback: Correct: Urine is produced in the nephrons, which are housed in each of the two kidneys. The kidneys are located toward the lower back.

response.name: bladder
response.feedback: Incorrect: Urine is produced in the nephrons, which are housed in each of the two kidneys. Once filtered, the blood exits through the renal vein and urine leaves each kidney through each ureter which is driven to the bladder

part.hint: Think in terms of what organ produces urine.

response.name: kidneys
response.feedback: Incorrect: Urine is produced by the nephrons which are in the kidneys.

response.name: nephrons
response.feedback: Incorrect: Urine is produced by the nephrons in the kidneys.

response.name: bladder
response.feedback: Correct: Urine is produced by the nephrons in the kidneys. Once filtered, the blood exits through the renal vein and urine leaves each kidney through each ureter which is driven to the bladder, where it is contained.

part.hint: Think in terms of where it is stored once it is produced.
